content.raw:
It's a little odd to relocate (and rename) some libs to satisfy a particular build workflow.  But if it's an important workflow and this is the best fix, so be it.

Do you know why we don't have the same problem with the shared objects built in `drcsim_gazebo_ros_plugins`?  They're still being installed to `<prefix>/lib/drcsim_gazebo_ros_plugins/plugins`.

content.raw:
It doesn't feel clean to me, but without this fix, isolated builds don't work (the builds have to be isolated when I build against a custom gazebo branch). I'm open to suggestions.

The problem is that drcsim_gazebo_ros_plugins needs to find the DRCVehiclePlugin library, but since it wasn't installed to `lib`; it can't  be found.

Any ideas?
